TopicTitle: I present to you - 'The Gash' in 3d

Articles.Content:
So we\'ve all seen this baby on the Mun in v14.3. Those two parallel lines near the equator. It looks like some channel pointing to the big dark crater.

Well, I thought the Kerbal Geographic SocietyÃ¯Â¿Â½ should map such a distinguishing feature and here you have it. The topography of the gash. Note that each side of the gash is mostly equal height but the gradient (ie the slope) is far more severe on one side which is the most obvious landmark when in Mun orbit.

I think I\'ll map the community Mun base next.

Edited August 10, 2012 by togfox

It\'s a giant alien head blowing on something!

Must be the kerman in the mun?

It\'s a giant alien head blowing on something!

Must be the kerman in the mun?

O_O It totally is

It\'s a giant alien head blowing on something!

Must be the kerman in the mun?

WHAT?! IT CANNOT BE!
It\'s Homer Simpson eating a pancake with no hands.

It\'s Homer Simpson eating a pancake with no hands.

Why wouldn\'t the pancake have hands? That\'s just silly.

Amazing Mun Science

How do you make these?

With the help of Corax crxTelemetry and physically exploring the area with a Mun rover.

Old school. Like it was done in the old days.

I\'m trying to refine and streamline this and when I do I\'ll post instructions. I\'m waiting on some scheduled updates to the crxTelemetry mod.
I recommend changing the name of this terrain feature... because there are little kids here, I won\'t say it, but the word 'Gash' is slang term for something a little inappropriate.

I recommend changing the name of this terrain feature... because there are little kids here, I won\'t say it, but the word 'Gash' is slang term for something a little inappropriate.

Since when? Gash is, literally, 'a long, deep cut.'
If we stop using all the words that someone, somewhere, has used to mean something sexual, we\'ll have about three left.

If we stop using all the words that someone, somewhere, has used to mean something sexual, we\'ll have about three left.

Gash is a pretty common slang term for that. It\'s not just an obscure one that one person said once.

Gash is a pretty common slang term for that. It\'s not just an obscure one that one person said once.

Never heard of this term. Thought it was a drug reference when you said something.
I just googled it. It seems to be a UK thing. I\'ll let the forum Mods decide if there is a problem but point noted.

When the mun first was released, I always wanted my first mun flight to come down through a canyon.

The gash made my day
Hmmm.....does anyone think it would be possible to orbit through the thing?
Unlikely. Check the heights in my map. Its high for a rover but shallow for a high speed orbiter. The entance/exit is steep too.
Heh. Totally gonna go fly my rocket into the Mun\'s gash (and yeah, it\'s an extraordinarily common term in the UK; frowned upon, but common).

Gash is a pretty common slang term for that. It\'s not just an obscure one that one person said once.

From now on the headlights must be called vehicle forward illumination devices, beavers will be called dam building mammals, everyone named Richard must change their name, 300 million chinese with the last name of Wang will need to change their name. Clams are now simply an unidentified shellfish, Lizards are now to be referred to only as reptiles, muffins are now cupcakelike baked goods, there is no longer a number between 68 and 70, 'it' is to be replaced with 'Thingy' 'Thingy' is banned and to be replace with 'Whatchamacallit'. The fiddle is now to be called Rooftop musical instrument.

On one of my first flights in .142 i made a low Mun orbit that accidentally passed through the Gash. At some point the orbit actually dipped below the altitude of the surrounding landscape:

(just after passing, looking back, pointing retrograde)

http://img88.imageshack.us/img88/4127/screenshot4re.png

The fiddle is now to be called Rooftop musical instrument.

That\'s a lot to remember, but OK.

The fiddle is now to be called Rooftop musical instrument.

Hahahahaha

That\'s clever.
